benchmark_details.name: MuTox (Universal MUltilingual Audio-based TOXicity Dataset and Zero-shot Detector)
benchmark_details.overview: MuTox is the first highly multilingual audio-based dataset with toxicity labels, comprising 20,000 audio utterances for English and Spanish, and 4,000 for the other 28 languages, designed for audio-based toxicity detection.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for multilingual audio-based toxicity detection across 30 languages.

data.source: The dataset consists of audio utterances labeled with toxicity, selected from speech transcriptions and annotated manually across multiple languages.
data.size: 20,000 utterances for English and Spanish, 4,000 utterances for each of the other 28 languages

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on performance comparisons between the MuTox classifier and existing text-based classifiers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores and AUC values indicate better performance in toxicity detection.
methodology.baseline_results: MuTox improves F1-Score over wordlist-based classifiers by an average of 100%.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of the MuTox dataset and classifier was validated through performance comparisons with text-based toxicity detectors.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes a diverse set of speakers across different languages, which may contribute to varying perceptions of toxicity.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential for misclassifying non-toxic content as toxic, leading to unintended bias in the classifier's performance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: N/A - Data collection procedures are compliant with ethical guidelines.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Annotators were informed of the content and could opt-out.
